text: This is a list of people scheduled to be executed in the United States. ==Summary of scheduled executions== As of , 2020, a total of 41 people are scheduled to be executed in the United States.Death Penalty Information Center - Executions Scheduled for 2020 (Last updated on March 19, 2019) 38 of these executions are scheduled over five calendar years in three U.S. states, while 3 are scheduled to be carried out by the United States Federal Government. {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center; font-size:100%;" |- ! colspan="5" style="background- color:#FFDD75;" | |- |} ==List of offenders previously scheduled to be executed== The following offenders had previously been scheduled for execution in 2020. They were, however, removed from the execution schedule. The typical reason is the issuance of a stay of execution. {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text- align:center; font-size:100%;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="background- color:#A8E4A0; width:100px;" |Number ! rowspan="2" style="background- color:#A8E4A0; width:150px;" |Date of execution ! rowspan="2" style="background-color:#A8E4A0; width:275px;" |Name ! rowspan="2" style="background-color:#A8E4A0; width:150px;" |Date of birth ! colspan="3" style="background-color:#A8E4A0; width:200px;" |Age of offender ! rowspan="2" style="background-color:#A8E4A0; width:100px;" |Gender ! rowspan="2" style="background-color:#A8E4A0; width:100px;" |Ethnicity ! rowspan="2" style="background-color:#A8E4A0; width:100px;" |State ! rowspan="2" style="background-color:#A8E4A0; width:150px;" |Method ! rowspan="2" style="background-color:#A8E4A0; width:1000px;" |Reason for Stay ! rowspan="2" style="background-color:#A8E4A0; width:150px;" |Source |- ! style="background- color:#A8E4A0; width:100px;" |At execution ! style="background-color:#A8E4A0; width:100px;" |At offense ! style="background-color:#A8E4A0; width:100px;" |Age difference |- |1 | | | |55 |38 |17 | rowspan="10" |Male |Black |Federal Government | rowspan="7" |Lethal injection |U.S. District Judge Tanya S. Chutkan ruled that the procedure approved likely violates the Federal Death Penalty Act. |Profile: |- |2 | | | |58 |26 |32 | rowspan="3" |White |Georgia |Jimmy Fletcher Meders had his sentence commuted to life without parole. |Profile: |- |3 | | | |44 |34 |10 |rowspan="5" |Texas |rowspan="3" |These men were issued a temporary stay of execution by the Texas Court of Criminal Appeals due to the coronavirus pandemic. |Profile: |- |4 | | | |59 |42 |17 |Profile: |- |5 | | | |44 |31 |13 |Hispanic |Profile: |- |6 | | | |60 |47 |13 |White |The Texas Court of Criminal Appeals issued a stay of execution for Randall Wayne Mays on intellectual disability grounds. |Profile: |- |7 | | | |43 |21 |22 |Hispanic |The Supreme Court of the United States issued a stay of execution for Ruben Gutierrez over issue of spiritual adviser. |Profile: |- |8 | | | |59 |27 |32 |White |Tennessee |Electrocution |Tennessee governor Bill Lee granted a temporary reprieve from execution for Harold Wayne Nichols until December 31, 2020 due to challenges and disruptions of the coronavirus pandemic. |Profile: |- |9 | | | |36 |20 |16 | rowspan="2" |Hispanic | rowspan="2" |Texas | rowspan="2" |Lethal injection |On 14 August 2020, judge Bobby Galvan of the 94th District Court canceled the death warrant. |Profile: |- |10 | | | |46 |22 |24 |Execution was suspended due to COVID-19. |Profile: |- class="sortbottom" |} ==See also== *List of death row inmates in the United States *List of juvenile offenders executed in the United States since 1976 *List of most recent executions by jurisdiction *List of offenders executed in the United States in 2020 *List of people executed in Texas, 2020–present *List of women executed in the United States since 1976 ==References== Executions Offenders executed in the United States Executions Offenders executed in the United States Executions Offenders executed in the United States Executions Offenders executed in the United States Executions Sched
title: List of offenders scheduled to be executed in the United States
